description: Bruce Wayne returns to Wayne Manor to find no trace of the Batcave, and Alfred without any knowledge of his master's crimefighting career. Has Bruce Wayne gone insane?
name: Identity Crisis

description: An assassin is loose in the streets of Gotham--an assassin using a technique only four people in the world know.
name: The Third Man

description:
Gotham City is changing into a digitized video game, with Batman and Robin caught inside.

Professor Powder escaped Arkham and begged for the help of (and warned) Batman and Gordon. They experienced strange digitized hallucinations as they saw Powder killed by a car. Parts of Gotham City were transformed into a video game for short periods of time.
name: Mind Games

description: Batman and Robin make their way through the digitized Arkham Asylum to put a stop to the culprit behind this absurd reality alteration. le Deadshot, Count Vertigo, and Steelwolf go up against the Khmer Rouge. "The Dragon's Horde" part 3.
name: Control Freak

description:
Master extortionist Savant has pushed Oracle's courage and Canary's will to their very limits! Now Babs reluctantly recruits the Huntress, while Dinah must make a sacrifice that leaves her more vulnerable than ever. Their final confrontation with the man who knows their weaknesses will have repercussions for months to come!

Oracle send Black Canary out on a mission which something ends up going horribly wrong... With no one else to help Oracle ask Huntress to help and to go find out what happened to Black Canary
name: Of Like Minds, Part Four- Finale

description: Bigger than issue #1! Twice as many writers! 2 Stories! Twice as many artists! Even more colorists! How is that possible?!?!?!!??!!? Read on fellow Red Sonja fan and you'll see how we make the ultimate Dynamite Red Sonja! Following last issue's cliffhanger ending the new tales of Sonja continue from Dynamite Carey Oeming Rubi Isanove Rodriguez and the best of the best cover artists! In this issue the drama continues to unfold as new foes are met new allies found and new challenges rise to meet the She-Devil With a Sword! When the curtain is pulled back what evil will truly be revealed? Featuring covers by: (shipping in equal increments with the exception of the Rare Chase covers) JG Jones Art Adams Mel Rubi (Wraparound cover at no extra cost) and legendary Red Sonja artist Frank Brunner (colored by Jose Villarrubia)! Anda s if that weren't enough there will be inserted a 1-in-25 cover by Billy (X-23) Tan and a 1-in-65 alternate cover inserted with painted art by Esteban Maroto (Colored by Jose Villarrubia)! But WAIT! There's more! Red Sonja #2 will also have feature a special bonus prelude back-up to the upcoming Red Sonja Vs. Thulsa Doom! YES that Thulsa Doom! The Red Sonja Vs. Thulsa Doom story by filmmaker Luke Lieberman and NY Times Best Selling Author (and fan favorite comic writer) Peter David will lead in to the pre-cursor to Sonja's first appearance in Conan #23 and it all begins in Red Sonja #2 as part of a special preview! Best of all it's 40 pages with 7 new pages of story and art -- bigger than issue #1 -- all for the same price of just $2.99 AND featuring the premiere of Thulsa Doom!
name: The Flaming Skulls / Winds of Doom

description:
Overview

The action ratchets up across five issues in August guest-starring Zatanna, the Teen Titans, the JLA, Poison Ivy, the Penguin, the Atom and more! Karate Kid ventures to Oracle for answers. Jimmy Olsen attempts to join not one but two exclusive clubs. Mary Marvel falls deeper into temptation. And Donna Troy and Jason Todd journey into the Nanoverse!

Plus, starting in COUNTDOWN 38, a series of backup stories recounting the origins of DC's greatest villians,

written by Scott Beatty (BATGIRL: YEAR ONE)!
name: All Hell!

first_appearance_locations.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

location_credits.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

description: In this one-issue interlude from our sprawling Flycatcher saga, we turn our attention back to The Farm. Snow White and Bigby's cubs are turning five years old, so it's time for a celebration! But none of them are expecting the amazing present they get this year. Plus, the timelines between FABLES AND JACK OF FABLES converge in strange, unexpected ways.
name: The Birthday Secret

character_credits.name: The Old Woman who lived in a Shoe

first_appearance_characters.name: The Old Woman who lived in a Shoe

description: Fear spreads across the universe as "Sinestro Corps" continues! Stranded on Qward, Hal Jordan faces an army of Sinestro's greatest soldiers…and his secret weapon! Meanwhile, the Guardians of the Universe discover a "traitor" in their midst as an ages-old secret leaks out. Plus, an even greater evil waits on the horizon, one that will plague the DCU long after this war is over. .
name: Sinestro Corps War Part 4: Running Scared

description: When Fraklin Richards, the son of Reed Richards and the Invisible Woman, two members of the Fantastic Four, and Alex power, a member an "ex" member of the Power Pack, escape from the city because they are tired of people just wanting to be their friends to get to Fantastic Four. Now Fantastic Four and the rest of the Power Pack must team up, before Dr. Doom kidnaps the tow boys.
name: The Utterly Awesome Adventure of Mass Master & Fabulous Frank!

description:
Overview

After several years as a whiskey-soaked, washed-up boxer-turned-mob enforcer, the palooka Jack Murdock has turned his life around. He's cleaned himself up, seen his son Matt off to law school and revitalized his career. But after a string of wins, the Fixer returns to call in a favor, and demands that Jack lose his shot-at-the-championship bout…by a knockout! Step into the ring and inside the head of Daredevil's father, in this series by Italian sensation Carmine Di Giandomenico and Zeb Wells!
name: Round 3

description:
“Battle for Eternity” continues! Albion’s team has destroyed technology in England! The Excalibur team is on the ropes and Albion’s forces are growing!

Again, someone dies in this issue.
name: Turn Back The Clock

description:
Overview

It's the shocking conclusion of "TO THE DEVIL, HIS DUE" as the knife twists in Matt Murdock's back, and his life leaps off the rails once again. The villain who's been ripping Hell's Kitchen apart is revealed, as DD leaps into the fight of his life!

Also, Milla does something that will have major repercussions on the rest of her life.
name: To The Devil, His Due; Part five (of five)

description: The return of Preus, the villain from the hit storyline "Godfall!" The rogue Kandorian cop is assembling followers on Earth to declare a holy war on the Man of Steel!
name: Worship False Gods

description: Continuing from the pages of Fathom comes a story of ultimate loss, hidden fury, unresolved grief, and longing revenge, all shrouded behind the uncompromising face of the Blue warrior known only as Kiani. As a previously unseen faction of the Blue make their presence known, Kiani makes a crucial decision relating to the final events of Fathom Volume 2...and embarks upon a quest that will lead her to answers she may not want to know! Written by Vince Hernandez and illustrated by Marcus (Soulfire: Chaos Reign) To, this incredible 12-page zero issue sets the stage for the upcoming Kiani #1. Loaded with tons of extra sketches and concept designs for the series, this is one zero issue you won't want to miss!
name: The Fire Within

description: With a shocking discovery turning her world upside down, the Elite warrior Kiani finds herself facing the toughest decision she's ever been forced to make! Meanwhile, a race of isolated and deadly Blue inhabitants come closer to linking the fate of their civilization to the fate of Kiani herself! Following on the heels of the first issue's shocking conclusion, Kiani #2 will finally answer the long-anticipated mystery surrounding Kiani's secret heritage!
name: The Tide Less Traveled

description:
Batman must find a way to stop a human bomb from destroying Gotham City.

Batman is contacted by the Army to assist in finding a dangerous weapon... The Bomb. The Bomb has the ability to create explosions. Is the Army telling the whole story to Batman about the Bomb? Is it really going to blow up Gotham City?
name: The Bomb
The Idiot Root Part Two : The Queen of Hearts
The Idiot Root Part Four : The Cook, the Bat and the Idiot
The Destroyer Part Three: A Dream Is Forever
The Return of Scarface Part Two: Gleeding Hearts

description: Batman tracks a serial killer whom he's convinced is a librarian murdering his victims based on categories within the Dewey Decimal System.
name: The Library of Souls

description:
Buzz Galvan goes to the electric chair...and survives. After the courts decree that he must be set free, he begins a campaign of revenge against all who gathered to watch him die.

Convicted murderer Buzz Galvin somehow survived being executed via electric chair and is hunting down those who condemned him. For reasons yet to be revealed, he is being pursued by the Electrocutioner.
name: Electric City Part 1 : Wired

description:
An executed man has come back from the dead to embark on a killing spree, with only Robin to stop him.

After a brief tussle with the Electrocutioner, Robin convinces him to let he and Batman help in tracking down Galvan, a murderer with electric-based powers of his own. Batman manages to track down Galvan but he escapes and heads for his next victim - James Gordon.
name: Electric City Part 2 : Grounded!

description: uzz Galvan continues his killing spree until only one name remains on his hit list...Commissioner Gordon. It's up to Batman and Robin to prevent the murder and expose the role of the Electrocutioner. All as Commissioner Gordon works up the nerve to propose to Sarah.
name: Electric City Part 3 : Systemic Shock

description: First appearance of Stephanie Brown! The Cluemaster is out of prison and cured of his compulsion to leave clues at his crime scenes, freeing him to perpetrate his schemes without the intervention of Batman and Robin.
name: Inquiring Minds

deck: Robin locates Cluemaster's daughter in order to help track him down.
description: Batman and Robin must figure out who is leaving clues and where they point. The Cluemaster wants to know the same thing...and doesn't care who he has to kill in order to find out.
name: Let the Puzzlement Fit the Crime

deck: Batman has a showdown with Cluemaster at a costume party.
description: Batman and Robin must stop the Cluemaster's most extravagant crime yet: a robbery at the grand opening of a mall, where the Spoiler plans to have her own revenge on the Cluemaster.
name: Malled

description:
Harold and Ace find strange things hidden in the depths of the Batcave, while Robin tries to prevent a murder planned more than fifty years ago.

While mapping the cave, Harold learned that it connected to the Gotham Subway System. Robin saved a news crew from a booby-trapped vault. They were opening a long-dead gangster's "tomb" on live TV.
name: The Dragon
A Bullet for Bullock

description: When the Huntress and Batman attempt to take down a gang of hoods they learn these crooks have diplomatic immunity. The tables are turned as the two vigilantes find themselves wanted by the law.
name: Beyond the Law!

description: The Dark Knight and the Huntress team up to take on a group of terrorists.
name: The Serpent Pit

description: The mind of a ruthless military genius trapped in the body of an 11-year-old boy makes for a deadly combination, which Batman discovers when he is outnumbered by Gotham's street gangs gathered under the banner of the General.
name: God of Battle

description:
The Dark Knight takes on the united gangs of Gotham, all led by the military-minded General, who resides in the body of an 11-year-old boy.

  1. The Anvil of War (Batman & The General): Batman attempted to break up a gang war, but his exhaustion kicked in. Barely surviving, he retreated to the cave. He took a couple days off, only going out undercover to gather information. He learned the "General" was leading the unified gangs against the Gotham City Police.

  1. You May Think It's Not Your Problem ... (a public service message by Robin & Alfred)
name: The Anvil of War ; You May Think It's Not Your Problem ...

description:
Gotham City has become a war zone, and Batman is caught in the middle of it all. Plus, a mysterious group observes the Dark Knight and plans to test his abilities further.

  1. Beseiged (Batman)

  2. You May Think It's Not Your Problem ... (public service message by Robin & Alfred)
name: Beseiged

description:
Someone is learning secrets from the heads of major Gotham City corporations, and then causing them to commit suicide...and Lucius Fox, C.E.O. of Bruce Wayne's companies, is next on the list.

Prominent CEO's are comitting suicide, break-ins at Wayne Enterprise, and an inside man that Batman is relying on that is not Robin. What is going on. Why does Fox have feelings of doom, what is the Government doing in Wayne-Tech, and most intriguing of all, Robin is teaming up with someone who isn't Bruce ?
name: Null and Void

description:
Caught between a rock and a hard place, Batman has to face the climax of the Joker's homicidal foray into film production and cope with an internal struggle between the demands of the System and his own humanity.

This issue features Batman/Jean Paul Valley
name: Losing the Light

description:
A Zero Hour crossover issue. As Batman returns to the Batcave, he finds himself affected by one of the Zero Hour time disruptions. He returns to a Wayne Manor of the past, where he finds his father and mother. However, in this disrupted world, it was eight-year-old Bruce Wayne that was murdered, not Thomas and Martha Wayne. Out for vengeance, Batman hunts down Joe Chill, knowing exactly who the culprit is in young Bruce Wayne’s murder. However, he finds Joe Chill strung out on drugs for the last two days. Batman finds that Joe Chill was not the murderer. Upset that he wasted his time on vengeance instead of spending it with his parents, Batman rushes back to Wayne Manor, to find time back to normal. Batman is left to wonder if Joe Chill was innocent in that alternate past, or if he was also innocent in our timeline.

Notes:

  • Murray Boltinoff's passing is mentioned in two paragraphs of the letter column.
name: Yesterdays Gone

description:
"Prodigal" part 3, continued from BATMAN: SHADOW OF THE BAT #32. Bruce Wayne's decision has dire consequences for those close to Batman. And the Ratcatcher returns with a serious grudge against the Dark Knight. Plus, Robin learns that Two-Face has escaped. Continued in ROBIN (1993-2009) #11.

(continued from SotB 32)

Batman and Robin learn of Harvey Dent’s accidental release from prison, as well as the escape of the Ratcatcher. Feeling Harvey has not had enough time to hatch a scheme, Batman chooses to focus all of his attention on the Ratcatcher, trying to stay one step ahead of him. Robin has a near-fatal mistake, which brings back bad memories for Dick regarding a mistake he made during his time as Robin which led to the death of a man. Batman eventually tracks down the Ratcatcher and stops his scheme as Harvey Dent begins to put his plans into motion. Meanwhile, Robin’s father, Jack Drake, attempts to spend more quality time with his son.

(continued in Robin 11)
name: Prodigal Three : The Vermin Factor

description:
"Prodigal" part 7, continued from BATMAN: SHADOW OF THE BAT #33. The new Batman has a showdown with Two-Face in Gotham City's Hall of Records, a confrontation that becomes a disturbing mirror for the dark episode in the Dark Knight's past, continued in ROBIN (1993-2009) #12.

Story continues in: Robin #12. This issye featured Batman/Dick Grayson
name: Prodigal Seven : A Twice Told Tale

description: The Final Issue of G.I.Joe A Real American Hero Vol. 1. In this Issue the Joe's mothball the PIT, as Snake-Eyes receives a letter from Sean Collins who wants to join the Military.
name: A Letter From Snake-Eyes

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero

description: There’s a stiff wind rustlin’ its way through Manhattan, straight towards Spidey! Awfully hard for our resident Wall-Crawler to crawl said walls when Whirlwind’s blowin’ ‘em down!
name: Whirlwind Tour

description: Fan-favorite artist Ethan Van Sciver (GREEN LANTERN: REBIRTH) joins writer Geoff Johns for an action-packed tale that pits Hal Jordan against the deadly new Shark as alien abductions across the West Coast increase dramatically!
name: Feeding Frenzy

description: Mutilated by the events of REBIRTH, Black Hand returns to wreak horrifying vengeance! Meanwhile, the bizarre experiments of a new alien race come to light with their current prisoner: Green Lantern. And how does this all connect with the Rann/Thanagar War?
name: Black Sheep

description: The Riddler's playing a deadly game, and Batman's the prize! Batgirl and Robin will need all of their training, wits and guts to save the Batman.
name: Shtick Shift

description: Part 1 of the 2-part story "A Perfect Life." Out of the pages of Infinite Crisis explodes a villain who's had devastating effects on the life of Hal Jordan!
name: A Perfect Life Part 1

description: Green Lantern and Green Arrow confront Mongul, the destroyer of worlds!
name: A Perfect Life Part 2

description:
Batsu, a new transfer student at Taiyo High School is investigating the disappearance of his mother. There he learns that other students have disappeared and are possibly connected to his mother.

He ends up getting in a fight with Hayato, the gym teacher of Taiyo High.
The Green Lantern and Batman team-up to take down Tattooed Man who is running loose in Gotham!
name: Branded

description:
"Prodigal" part 11, continued from BATMAN: SHADOW OF THE BAT #34.! A "big armored guy with steel wings and claws" has committed a series of murders in Gotham City, leading Batman to seek out Jean Paul Valley, the former armored Dark Knight. Continued in ROBIN (1993-2009) #13.

Story continues in: Robin #13. This issue features Batman/Dick Grayson. Both Bruce Wayne and Jean-Paul Valley make guest appearances
name: Prodigal Eleven : Knight Without Armor

description:
"Troika" part 3, continued from BATMAN: SHADOW OF THE BAT #35. Batman crosses swords with Romana as the Troika's hold on Gotham's underworld tightens. Meanwhile, Robin chases down the KGBeast! Continued in ROBIN (1993-2009) #14.

Story continued from: Batman : Shadow of the Bat #35

Story continues in : Robin #14
name: Troika, Part Three: The Doomsday Clock

description:
Batman and Robin have been hard at work putting a hurt on the criminal underworld. However, the arch rogue known as the Penguin plans to enact a scheme that will be the end of the Dynamic Duo.

Penguin questioned a big winner at his casino. The man used logic and a great memory to break the bank at a black jack table. Penguin decided to use him to help plan heists where Batman would not be involved. The first failed, but the logician gathered info (and the robbery was successful).
name: Odds Against

description:
With the help of the Actuary, Penguin intends to find out why all his schemes have failed against the Batman. When the flaw in his past exploits is revealed, the foul bird plans a heist in broad daylight.

Batman questioned the man he'd captured during the previous robbery; Black Mask made a move in the mob scene by taking out a rival; Penguin planned a daylight robbery. Batman used his source to take down the plot, but was unable to pin anything on Penguin due to his logician taking full responsibility. Bullock recovered from his run-in with the KGBeast and was released from the hospital.
name: Darkest Day

description: "War of the Dragons" part 1! Tensions begin to rise in Chinatown as Lynx grows agitated over King Snake's head position in the Triads. As war breaks between dragons, the Dark Knight and Boy Wonder find themselves caught in the middle of the gang war. Continued in ROBIN (1993-2009) #17.
name: War of the Dragons: Part One : The Iron Dragon

description:
"War of the Dragons" part 3, continued from ROBIN #17. The war between the gangs of Chinatown reaches its epic conclusion as the Dark Knight and the Boy Wonder track King Snake, the Silver Monkey and Lynx to the docks for a final confrontation.

Story continued from: Robin #17
name: War of the Dragons: Part Three : The Winged Dragon

description:
The Dark Knight steps out of his element when he attempts to stop a river pirate who is preying upon Gotham City's yachts and gambling boats.

Gotham by a group of pirates led by Captain Fear.
name: Red Tide

description:
Captain Fear leaves Batman in an escapable trap, facing the deadly currents of the Gotham River.

Batman is tied to a buoy and trying to escape (without his utility belt), while Robin is trying to track him down, using the signal which is being transmitted from Batman's utility belt. All of this is more than half the issue, the other half is Robin taking on the guys with Batman's utility belt, and Batman freeing himself and meeting up with Robin just as he needs help.
name: The Rip

description:
The fiery villain Firefly breaks out of Blackgate Prison, burning to join the Black Mask's gang.

Firefly gains a new love interest, Deelia Withers.
name: The Blazing Heart

description:
Batman and Robin struggle to contain a life threatening blaze when Firefly's "hot" date becomes an inferno.

Batman and Robin crush a date of Firefly and Deelia Withers.
name: Burning Love

description:
An UNDERWORLD UNLEASHED tie-in issue! The Dark Knight faces the new Spellbinder, born of a deal with Neron and possessing the power to create illusions with dangerously concrete effects.

The Spell Binder attempts to trap the Dynamic Duo using his special reality warping machine, making the heroes see a world that isn't real, with deadly consequences as they go through the real world!
name: Will It Go 'Round in Circles

description:
An UNDERWORLD UNLEASHED tie-in issue! Batman and Robin struggle against the senses-altering powers of the deadly new, Neron-enhanced Spellbinder.

As Lady Spellbinder confuses the Dynamic Duo, seemingly more problems lie ahead. As Batman gains information from Oracle, while fighting the Spellbinder later on, he has to trust Tim Drake with his life as he has his eyes in the real world. Will Tim Drake be able to guide the Batman or will he lead him to his doom?
name: Lying Eyes

description:
Batman is caught in the middle of a vicious confrontation between Poison Ivy and Allergent, a deadly new villain killing Gotham's flora with an insidious defoliant.

Batman and Robin, along with the major crimes unit, investigated an explosion and strange gas in a Gotham City park. The gas turned out to be a defoliant, killing all plants in its path. The police closed in on the man, dubbed the Weedwhacker - a man who suffered from extreme allergies. He escaped their pursuit, but the Batmobile gave chase.
name: Systemic Shock

description: Batman and Robin must find and stop Allergent before Poison Ivy murders the environmentally unfriendly terrorist. Plus, Gotham City gets a new Commissioner of Police.
name: Violent Reactions

description:
Batman investigates a rash of criminal disappearances, including Two-Face, Charaxes, and others, and uncovers a would-be cop kidnapping Gotham's worst and imprisoning them in his own private maximum security prison.

Note: This issue bears a "Special Thanks" credit for Paul Dini; Dini was the creator of the original Lock-Up as seen on Batman: The Animated Series.
name: Deadbolt

description:
Batman, Robin, and Nightwing go undercover in order to set a trap for Lock-Up, a former cop holding villains hostage in his own private dungeon. But the plan goes awry when it's Robin who's trapped! "Locked Down" part 3.

Lock-up (Lyle Bolton) refused to give the location of his captives. Unless they let him go, he insisted they would starve to death. He escaped. Batman and Robin went out undercover to check on possible targets, Nightwing checked on yet another. He took down his target when he found that he'd abducted yet another child. "Matches" Malone met with some mobsters. Robin found Lock-up and was taken by him - he thought he was a gun-runner. "Matches" got the shake down from the mobsters.
name: The Tomb

description:
Robin is jailed alongside Two-Face and Charaxes. With Batman deluged by mobsters, it's up to Nightwing to save the Boy Wonder from Lock-Up before the villain snares them all. "Locked Down" part 4.

Story continues in: Robin #31
name: The Chain

description: Batman and his allies are on the trail of the last remnants of Ra's virus, with each splitting up to protect a probable location with the virus set to be released at a newly opening Gotham casino, Batman calls for his allies to rendezvous, leading to the long awaited rematch between Batman and Bane.
name: Gotham's Scourge

description: It's One Year Later...and Hal Jordan is about to embark on one of his greatest challenges ever! Join writer Geoff Johns and new series art team Ivan Reis & Marc Campos for Part 1 of "Revenge of the Green Lanterns!" Who is the Grandmaster of the Manhunters? What is the Igneous Man? Where is Sinestro? And why will the most unlikely of sons become one of Hal Jordan's greatest enemies?
name: Revenge of the Green Lanterns Part 1

description: "Revenge of the Green Lanterns"continues! Hal Jordan once left his fellow Lanterns for dead. Now he's discovered they're alive, and he'll do anything to rescue them from their horrible prison. But what heroes have begun to distrust Jordan? And what are they planning to do about it?
name: Revenge of the Green Lanterns Part 2

description: As Gotham tries to recover from a deadly virus, Ra's al Ghul's followers attack police headquarters.
name: Second Chances

description:
A FINAL NIGHT tie-in issue! The sun is gone and the creeps in Gotham come out at night. Luckily, the city has its protectors.

Gotham is chilling up not because Mr. Freeze is in town, but rather because the events of The Final Night. The Dynamic duo as well as Huntress must fight the fears, disagreements and bad guys that only come out in the dark.

(Plus, The Riddler has his arm broken, an omen of what is yet to come.)
name: Howling in the Dark

description:
The story of Dieter Ganz and his clumsy career as a Burglar.

The issue presumably starts with Batman's thoughts, acquainting us with the story of Dieter Ganz, AKA Al Gabone (a nickname given to him by the cops in Gotham City). His first crime started and ended quickly at a liquor store in Eastlyn, where the paper bag he used as a mask interfered with his vision causing him to lose his footing. The cops arrived in time to save his life from getting beaten to death by the store clerk. This being his first felony, it placed him inside of Blackgate for 5 years. Good behavior got him out in 3 years.

On his second day out, Dieter tried to hold up a gas station, but the spray paint he used for his his resulted in intoxication. This time, he went back to Blackgate for 10 years. He was out in 5 years again, because of his good behavior. After he got out, he was back in the game. Dieter had a successful felony, but the note he gave to the cashier had his address on the other side. The cops were already waiting for him on his way home. He received 10 years at Blackgate, no parole.

Dieter finally gets out and is out looking for a job. His friend Nate hooks him up with Nash Cameron AKA The Toolbox, who's looking for a driver. Ganz agrees as long as it's nothing illegal. The three drive to a jewelry place where Nate and Nash bust in to rob the place. Ganz (unaware of what is really going on) is stuck in the middle and is coaxed into driving.

The Gotham Police Department gets on the chase and so does Batman and Robin who were aware of Nash's activities in Gotham City. Ganz tries to reason with Nate and Nash, but in doing so, he angers Nash even more leading to shooting back at the GPD, causing a collision between two patrol cars.

The three end up in the sewage system trying to escape. Batman and Robin (who switched their radar on in the Bat mobile) keep on the pursuit. They finally reach an Alley by Mundy Laundry Co., where Batman is waiting for them. They decide to keep on going by foot, entering a building in the docks. Nate and Nash are caught, but Dieter runs away. Batman states that the 'driver' will turn up in due time, since they always come back to that line of work.

The issues end's with Batman's thoughts about Al Gabone. Some time passes and Dieter opens up and electronics shop, keeping the promise he kept to himself. Starting a new live, away from trouble and from double parking.
name: Rocket Scientist

description:
The Riddler. The Cluemaster. The true dynamic duo. DETECTIVE COMICS #705, "Badd Girls," by Chuck Dixon, Graham Nolan, Gloria Vazquez, John Constanza, and guest inker, David Roach.

Riddler's women Echo and Query sprung Arthur "Cluemaster" Brown from prison while Riddler escaped from custody in a hospital. Nigma tied explosives to Cluemaster (whom he considered a faker) and told Batman where to find him. Batman had fifteen minutes to solve a batch of riddles or Brown exploded.
name: Badd Girls

description: Cyborg Superman returns as "Revenge of the Green Lanterns" continues! Blackest night falls when Hal Jordan and Guy Gardner find themselves face to face with a group of Green Lantern P.O.W.s deep in the heart of Sector 3601. Meanwhile, learn about the case that has taken over John Stewart's life!
name: Revenge of the Green Lanterns Part 3

description:
1. The Case of the Crimeless Crimes (Superman - First appearance of the Prankster)
  2. Captain Arthur Wermuth, One Man Army (Supermen of the U.S. Army)
  3. Guns, Gold, and Glory (Vigilante)
  4. Silly Willy
  5. The Valley of the Vultures (Three Aces)
  6. The Framer (Mr. America)
  7. Some Must Fight
  8. Rollin' Stone
  9. Congo Bill Joins the Flying Tigers (Congo Bill)
  10. Shorty
  11. Jerry the Jitterbug
  12. The Case of the Coconut Crimes (Zatara)

Superman:

As Lois and Clark visit a bowling alley, some thugs burst in to rob the manager. Clark foils the robbery and as the thugs try to escape in a car, he changes to Superman and races after them. However, when he catches up to the car, the thugs vanish, seemingly into thin air, but in fact they have hidden under false floorboards in the car.

The thugs work for the Prankster, and over the next few days he stages several raids on banks. Rather than robbing the banks, however, he actually gives increasingly large amounts of money to the managers. Both Superman and the police capture the Prankster's gang, but as he hasn't committed any crime more serious than being a nuisance, they have to let him go.

Finally, the Prankster shows up at the Metropolitan National Bank and donates more than $60,000 to the manager, but this time he insists on placing it in the vault personally. The Prankster's plan is now revealed - by giving money to banks he gained the trust of the managers and thus gained entry to the final bank's vault, which contains millions in cash and jewels.

Capturing Lois as a hostage, he and his thugs return to his headquarters, where he betrays his henchmen by sealing them (and Lois) in a room that fills with poison gas.

Superman arrives to save them, but in the confusion the Prankster escapes, only to find that Superman had switched his loot for blank paper.
name: The Case of the Crimeless Crimes

description: 1. The Skyscraper Superman!(Superman) -- 2. Cap's Hobby Center -- 3. The Ugly Duckling Teacher of Stanhope College (Supergirl)
name: Surprised to See Superbaby From the Planet of Krypton? Turn the Page and See Him as a Grown-Up As... The Skyscraper Superman! Best Superman Story of the Year!

description: Overview A tribute to the dead is interrupted by a new Silver Banshee! As Superman and Jack Ryder pay their respects to a photographer caught in the crossfire of a supervillain rampage, Silver Banshee comes screaming from the pits of Hell!
name: Wail Of The Banshee!

description:
1. The Emperor of America (Superman) -- 2. Sky Fighter (Supermen of the U.S. Army) -- 3. Sing a Song of Six Guns (Vigilante) -- 4. Private Pete -- 5. The Battle of a Thousand Years (Three Aces) -- 6. The Case of the Stolen Spectacles (Americommandos - Mr. America) -- 7. Wolf Hunt -- 8. Little Gertie -- 9. The One Man Army (Congo Bill) -- 10. Private Pete -- 11. Laffs -- 12. Crime on Ice (Zatara)
Superman: Inspired by the depths of World War 2 (the story was published after the USA had been involved in the war for a few months) this is a tale of an alternative future. Walking through Metropolis one day, Clark notices that everyone has become complacent and unwilling to resist anything that happens to them. 
The scene shifts to Washington, DC where a gang wearing strange metal helmets simply walks into the White House and orders the President to surrender power to the gang's leader, who calls himself the Emperor of America. The President complies without a struggle, and the Emperor assumes control of the country.
Meanwhile, Clark and Lois are on a plane to Washington to cover the story when the plane runs into bad weather. Clark escapes from the plane and performs several super-feats to save the plane from crashing into the mountains. Upon arrival in Washington, Clark and Lois go to the White House to request an interview with the Emperor, but he refuses. Lois is willing to just give up and leave, but Clark, unaffected by whatever is causing the complacency in everyone else, phones in a story to the Daily Planet in which he labels the Emperor as a tyrant. The Emperor has Clark and Lois arrested for treason, and replaces the supreme court with his own cronies, who convict them and sentence them to death.
As he is being led away, Clark grabs a metal helmet from one of the guards and discovers that it acts as a shield against whatever is causing everyone to obey any order. As Superman, he finds that the Emperor has built a gigantic ray machine which is causing the complacency, and he plans to rob America of its wealth and then destroy the ray machine, escaping to some foreign land. As Superman rushes in to stop him, the Emperor focuses the ray on him to try to control him, but Superman is able to resist the ray's effects and destroy the machine.
name: The Emperor of America

description: 1. The Menace of Red-Green Kryptonite! (Superman) -- 2. Ma and Pa Kent Adopt Supergirl! (Supergirl)
name: The Menace of Red and Green Kryptonite! : Extra! Mr. and Mrs. Kent Adopt Supergirl!

description: With Lois Lane on assignment overseas, Lana Lang is left to help Superman recover after his latest battle.  Will she prove to be a help to the Man of Steel or will she try to drive a rift between Lois and Clark?  In the aftermath of a conversation with Lana, Superman encounters two super-villains who operate as a loving couple, will they be able to take down the Man of Steel as their love for one another begins to test?  Don't miss this issue by Chuck Austen with Pencils by Ivan Reis & Joe Prado!
name: Sodom And Gomorrah

description:
Six months ago, Crossbones kidnapped the Red Skull's daughter from a government reeducation facility, and disappeared into the night. Now learn where they have been all this time, and what his plans are for this spawn of infinite evil. A special stand-alone issue, by Ed Brubaker and Mike Perkins, that lays the groundwork for the next year of Cap stories, and shines a spotlight on one of the strangest and misunderstood characters in the Marvel Universe.

We open with an awesome black and white flashback sequence...4 AWESOME pages!!! Then on to Crossbones, and his continued attampts to return the Red Skulls daughter..Sin...to her real self. There is a flashback scene, in color, of the moments just after she was born.He doesnt want her..he wanted a son, so a mysterious woman..Susan Scarbo, takes her and raises her...full of hate and contempt! Back to Crossbones and his punishing attempts to revert Sin to her former "glory" And by uissues end....it appears that he has been successful !.........
name: Red is the Darkest Color

description:
Fan-favorite creators Ed Brubaker and Steve Epting bring the most talked-about Captain America story in 40 years to a heartbreaking conclusion. Cap faces down his personal demons, in a hand-to-hand battle with the Winter Soldier. But he's not just fighting for victory, he's in a struggle for the heart and soul of everything he's ever cared about, and the results will send tragic echoes throughout his life for years to come!

The Winter Soldier has just taken a clear shot at the Falcon! And he has missed! Redwing, Falcon's trained falcon, has alerted the super quick Falcon in time.Cap attacks the Winter Soldier be throwing his shield and shattering Winter Soldier's gun. Cap chases him into the fallout shelter while Falcon tosses the team of baddies around outside. Cap and the Winter Soldier confront each other in this bunker and fight.The Winter Soldier still has the cosmic cube in a satchel with him. The fight is intense, Winter Soldier is intent on killing Cap, but Cap is trying hard to get W.S.to remember who he was/is. (Bucky) When Cap tells W.S. to go ahead and shoot, we think he wont.....but he does! Cap dodges it !!! As he does he tosses his shield and severs the strap on the satchel carried by W.S. As W.S. is wondering out loud how Cap dodged his shot, Cap has picked up the cube! He holds it up and says, "Remember who you are." A beautiful 2 page sepia-toned flashback ensues.And now Bucky remembers who he was/ is.He grabs the cube in his robotic left arm and crushes it against the better judgement of Cap , Falcon and Agent 13 (Sharon Carter)who have now joined Cap.And just like that Bucky is gone.......but he has only left quickly. He ends up at a deserted Camp Lehigh. There is a small flashback and we close with W.S./Bucky sitting on the ground, head in hands,...........remembering.........
name: The Winter Soldier, Part 6

description:
Batman and Robin try desperately to keep up with the Riddler's puzzles before the Cluemaster is blown to smithereens.

Batman, Robin, and Oracle try to solve clues before the Riddler blows up a dynamite vest the Cluemaster is wearing.
name: Lethal Pursuits

description: Batman and his team finally solve the puzzle of the Riddler's nefarious scheme. But will they be in time to save Gotham?
name: Riddled

description:
On his deathbed, a vengeful mob boss puts out contracts on several enemies. Unfortunately for Gotham, Deathstroke and Gunhawk are two of the assassins who take on the jobs.

Millionaires in Gotham City began being murdered. Gunhawk and Bunny were among the various contract killers in town for the $5 per. After his third straight botched job, Bunny left Gunhawk. He and Deathstroke both took aim at a charity event.
name: The Death Lottery Part One : Heart of Glass

description:
Lucius Fox is shot, another victim on Gunhawk and Deathstroke's hit lists. Batman must race to intercept the killers before they claim another victim.

Lucius Fox was shot in the arm. Another attack on his life was made while he was hospitalized, but Essen-Gordon and Bock were able to shoot the killer dead. Batman moved in on Deathstroke aiming at one of Bruce Wayne's neighbors.
name: The Death Lottery Part Two : Heart of Stone

description:
After going head to head with Deathstroke, Batman must do the unthinkable to stop Gunhawk from murdering J. Devlin Davenport: use a gun.

Gunhawk moved in on the millionaire as Batman battled Deathstroke. Robin and Oracle figure out the originator of the contracts - an aging millionaire on his deathbed. He wanted to outlive his competition, but he died before the police could arrive. Batman defeated Deathstroke; Essen-Gordon and Bock apprehended Gunhawk.

Note: Cover is a homage to a panel in Dark knight returns.
name: The Death Lottery Part Three : Heart of Ice

description: Young Harry Osborn has come to believe that his friend, Peter Parker, killed his father Norman when Peter was Spider-Man. Now, Harry plans a horrifying, misguided vengeance that could end Peter's life. Prepare for the battle of Spider-Man and the Hobgoblin!! Will either survive this epic encounter? Part 5 (of 6).
name: Hobgoblin: Part 5

description:
Batman must stop numerous crimes while maintaining his identity as Bruce Wayne.

Bruce Wayne escorts Lydia Granger to a Gotham Nature Conservation Party as a night off from being Batman. However, even as the mutlimillionaire playboy, he still finds himself bringing justice to criminals everywhere he goes.
name: Knight Out

description: Someone from the early years of the Batma's career comes back. Problem is, Batman saw him die....DETECTIVE COMICS #712, "Gears of Justice," by Chuck, Graham, Gloria, John and Bob McLeod.
name: Gears of Justice

description: Batman dies. Or maybe Gearhead does (again). Find out in Detective Comics #713, by Chuck, Graham, Bob, Gloria and John.
name: Death Engine

description: When Batman finds himself on the trail of the Firefly, he crosses paths with John Jones...also known as the Martian Manhunter. It's in DETECTIVE COMICS #714, "A World for Burning," by Chuck, Graham, Gloria, John and guest inker Eduardo Barreto.
name: A World for Burning

description: Bat-toast (and the boy wonderbread?). How are they ever going to get out of this predicament? It's all in DETECTIVE COMICS #715, "Days of Fire," by Chuck, Graham, Eduardo, Gloria and John.
name: Days of Fire

description:
When a father learns how dangerous it can be to get involved with the mob, Batman is reminded that there are some lives even he cannot save.

A felon out on parole was killed protecting his family from a gang he owed money. He was on his way home from a heist in which he'd scored enough to pay them off.
name: Death Comes Home

description:
The unpredictable Gearhead returns with an all-new assortment of deadly appendages and a plan to turn Batman's own machines against him, leading to Batman vs. his own Batmobile!

Finch aka Gearhead returns with more of a vengeance for Batman, than ever. This time he's better equipped and more focussed on amushing Batman when he least suspects it.
name: Savage Metal

description: In the conclusion of a 2-part story, the man-machine named Gearhead sets a deathtrap that has the Batman imprisoned and unconscious inside the Batmobile.
name: Point of Impact

description: story continues in: Batman : Shadow of the Bat #73
name: Cataclysm! Prelude : Sound and Fury

description:
In the wake of the devastating quake, Batman and Robin try to find the mother of a lost little girl.

Batman and Robin spot a child named Jayrine looking for her mother among the ruins. She is sent to Detective Montoya at the police department for help. Meanwhile, Captain Sarah Gordon argues with a city official to release water from the Tri-Corner Reservoir.

On the other part of the city, rescue workers find something in the rubble. Patrols and a curfew make it difficult to move around at night. Robin visits Jayrine at the police department to ask about her mother. He approaches Penguin and asks for leads that would help fine Shakey Reardon, Jayrine's mother's boyfriend. Sarah is ferried back to the city where she meets her husband.

Robin catches up with Shakey and Jayrine's mother at their apartment about to leave the city. They abandon her and Robin goes back to check on her. Upon closer inspection, they find money inside the child's ragdoll. She finds a home in her grandparents' farm.
name: Statistics

description: Tracy Lawless continues his search for the truth about his brother Ricky’s death. Having made it as the driver of the crew Ricky use to work with, he is also getting closer Mallory his brother's ex, a bit too close even. But Tracy's past indiscretions are catching up with him as some hitmen try to take him out.
name: Lawless Part Three
